results.title: The World’s Last Samaritans, Straddling the Israeli-Palestinian Divide
results.abstract: Up a mountain in the West Bank, several hundred villagers practice an ancient Israelite religion while maintaining an ambiguous national identity.
results.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Gabby Sobelman

results.title: Sardinian Village Tries to Save an Ancient Tree Scorched by Fire
results.abstract: A team of experts, with the help of local residents and authorities, is trying to revive an ancient olive tree in the hilltop village of Cuglieri that was engulfed in a catastrophic wildfire.

multimedia.caption: Gianluigi Bacchetta, a professor at the University of Cagliari, trying to save “the Patriarch,” an ancient olive tree in the Sardinian village of Cuglieri.

results.title: Miscue After Miscue, U.S. Exit Plan Unravels
results.abstract: President Biden promised an orderly withdrawal. That pledge, compounded by missed signals and miscalculations, proved impossible.
results.byline: By Michael D. Shear, David E. Sanger, Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt, Julian E. Barnes and Lara Jakes
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: He Guarded Haiti’s Slain President. And He Was a Suspect in a Drug Inquiry.
results.abstract: Officials are examining whether President Jovenel Moïse’s killing was tied to the drug trade. The man in charge of his safety was a suspect in a major trafficking case, they say.

results.title: Athens Is Only Getting Hotter. Its New ‘Chief Heat Officer’ Hopes to Cool It Down.
results.abstract: Eleni Myrivili has been tasked with finding ways to help the Greek capital cope with ever-hotter heat waves that are expected to be part of life for years to come.

results.abstract: Families continued to swarm the airport in hopes of getting aboard American military planes. U.S. officials are now worried that Islamic State might launch an attack to damage the Taliban’s sense of control.

results.title: How the Taliban Turned Social Media Into a Tool for Control

results.title: ‘Super Taster’ Who Lost Sense of Smell Is Helping Italians Regain It
results.abstract: A celebrated epicure in Italy was devastated when Covid-19 first stole, then warped his sense of taste. Through training, Michele Crippa has recaptured some of it and is now on a quest to aid others.

results.title: In Melbourne, Australia, a protest against Covid restrictions turned violent.
results.abstract: The police said it was the first time officers had been forced to use “a range of nonlethal options” to disperse anti-lockdown protesters in Melbourne.

results.title: A Century After the Titanic Sank, a Film Tries to Rescue 6 Survivors’ Stories
results.abstract: “The Six,” a new documentary, attempts to track down the fate of Chinese sailors who survived the Titanic but were scattered by Western immigration laws.

results.title: Afghanistan Faces Economic Shock as Sanctions Replace Foreign Aid
results.abstract: The Taliban will be under pressure to keep a fragile economy afloat.

results.title: Biden’s Inaccurate Claims in Defending Afghanistan Withdrawal
results.abstract: The president made misleading or false claims about the reaction of allies to the withdrawal, the presence of Al Qaeda and conditions for Americans traveling to the Kabul airport.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: Biden Defends Afghanistan Evacuation as Thousands Besiege Kabul Airport
results.abstract: The president cited “significant progress’’ in getting Americans out of Afghanistan. But Afghans linked to U.S. troops and other Western groups fear being left behind.
